meanings.definition: A hole or hollow area within a solid object.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel found a cozy cavity in the tree to build its nest.
meanings.sent2: The cave had a deep cavity that echoed with every sound.
meanings.sent3: The cavity in the wall was the perfect hiding spot for the missing key.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a dark cavity after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The cavity in the ground was so deep, it seemed bottomless.

meanings.definition: A decayed area of a tooth.
meanings.sent1: The dentist filled the cavity in my tooth to prevent further decay.
meanings.sent2: Eating too much candy can lead to cavities in your teeth.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the cavity in my tooth was a tiny home for bacteria.
meanings.sent4: The cavity in his tooth was a black hole of pain.
meanings.sent5: The sharp pain in my tooth reminded me of the cavity that needed filling.
